chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon J, Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:21 a.m. Defendant Dillon J, Johnson in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14TR1384, 14TR1385, 14TR1386. Michlig speaks to agreement/joint resolution. State moves to amend Ct. 1 to 941.20(1)(a) and dismiss traffic citations. State--no restitution being requested/victim has been made whole. Court grants State's motion to amend and dismiss. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing. 

Court sentence
WHS
1 yr. POP
CC/CV
$200 DNA surcharge

In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
